14#ifndef DNS_DISPATCH_H
15#define DNS_DISPATCH_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file dns/dispatch.h
22 * \brief
23 * DNS Dispatch Management
24 * Shared UDP and single-use TCP dispatches for queries and responses.
25 *
26 * MP:
27 *
28 *\li All locking is performed internally to each dispatch.
29 * Restrictions apply to dns_dispatch_removeresponse().
30 *
31 * Reliability:
32 *
33 * Resources:
34 *
35 * Security:
36 *
37 *\li Depends on the isc_socket_t and dns_message_t for prevention of
38 * buffer overruns.
39 *
40 * Standards:
41 *
42 *\li None.
43 */
44
45/***
46 *** Imports
47 ***/
48
49#include <inttypes.h>
50#include <stdbool.h>
51
52#include <isc/buffer.h>
53#include <isc/lang.h>
54#include <isc/mutex.h>
55#include <isc/socket.h>
56#include <isc/types.h>
57
58#include <dns/types.h>
59
60ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
61
62/*%
63 * This event is sent to a task when a response comes in.
64 * No part of this structure should ever be modified by the caller,
65 * other than parts of the buffer. The holy parts of the buffer are
66 * the base and size of the buffer. All other parts of the buffer may
67 * be used. On event delivery the used region contains the packet.
68 *
69 * "id" is the received message id,
70 *
71 * "addr" is the host that sent it to us,
72 *
73 * "buffer" holds state on the received data.
74 *
75 * The "free" routine for this event will clean up itself as well as
76 * any buffer space allocated from common pools.
77 */
78
79struct dns_dispatchevent {
80 ISC_EVENT_COMMON(dns_dispatchevent_t); /*%< standard event common */
81 isc_result_t result; /*%< result code */
82 int32_t id; /*%< message id */
83 isc_sockaddr_t addr; /*%< address recv'd from */
84 struct in6_pktinfo pktinfo; /*%< reply info for v6 */
85 isc_buffer_t buffer; /*%< data buffer */
86 uint32_t attributes; /*%< mirrored from socket.h */
87};
88
89/*%
90 * This is a set of one or more dispatches which can be retrieved
91 * round-robin fashion.
92 */
93struct dns_dispatchset {
94 isc_mem_t *mctx;
95 dns_dispatch_t **dispatches;
96 int ndisp;
97 int cur;
98 isc_mutex_t lock;
99};
100
101/*@{*/
102/*%
103 * Attributes for added dispatchers.
104 *
105 * Values with the mask 0xffff0000 are application defined.
106 * Values with the mask 0x0000ffff are library defined.
107 *
108 * Insane values (like setting both TCP and UDP) are not caught. Don't
109 * do that.
110 *
111 * _PRIVATE
112 * The dispatcher cannot be shared.
113 *
114 * _TCP, _UDP
115 * The dispatcher is a TCP or UDP socket.
116 *
117 * _IPV4, _IPV6
118 * The dispatcher uses an IPv4 or IPv6 socket.
119 *
120 * _NOLISTEN
121 * The dispatcher should not listen on the socket.
122 *
123 * _MAKEQUERY
124 * The dispatcher can be used to issue queries to other servers, and
125 * accept replies from them.
126 *
127 * _RANDOMPORT
128 * Previously used to indicate that the port of a dispatch UDP must be
129 * chosen randomly. This behavior now always applies and the attribute
130 * is obsoleted.
131 *
132 * _EXCLUSIVE
133 * A separate socket will be used on-demand for each transaction.
134 */
135#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_PRIVATE 0x00000001U
136#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_TCP 0x00000002U
137#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_UDP 0x00000004U
138#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_IPV4 0x00000008U
139#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_IPV6 0x00000010U
140#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_NOLISTEN 0x00000020U
141#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_MAKEQUERY 0x00000040U
142#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_CONNECTED 0x00000080U
143#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_FIXEDID 0x00000100U
144#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_EXCLUSIVE 0x00000200U
145#define DNS_DISPATCHATTR_CANREUSE 0x00000400U
146/*@}*/
147
148/*
149 */
150#define DNS_DISPATCHOPT_FIXEDID 0x00000001U
151
152isc_result_t
153dns_dispatchmgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_dispatchmgr_t **mgrp);
154/*%<
155 * Creates a new dispatchmgr object.
156 *
157 * Requires:
158 *\li "mctx" be a valid memory context.
159 *
160 *\li mgrp != NULL && *mgrp == NULL
161 *
162 * Returns:
163 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS -- all ok
164 *
165 *\li anything else -- failure
166 */
167
168
169void
170dns_dispatchmgr_destroy(dns_dispatchmgr_t **mgrp);
171/*%<
172 * Destroys the dispatchmgr when it becomes empty. This could be
173 * immediately.
174 *
175 * Requires:
176 *\li mgrp != NULL && *mgrp is a valid dispatchmgr.
177 */
178
179
180void
181dns_dispatchmgr_setblackhole(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, dns_acl_t *blackhole);
182/*%<
183 * Sets the dispatcher's "blackhole list," a list of addresses that will
184 * be ignored by all dispatchers created by the dispatchmgr.
185 *
186 * Requires:
187 * \li mgrp is a valid dispatchmgr
188 * \li blackhole is a valid acl
189 */
190
191
192dns_acl_t *
193dns_dispatchmgr_getblackhole(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr);
194/*%<
195 * Gets a pointer to the dispatcher's current blackhole list,
196 * without incrementing its reference count.
197 *
198 * Requires:
199 *\li mgr is a valid dispatchmgr
200 * Returns:
201 *\li A pointer to the current blackhole list, or NULL.
202 */
203
204void
205dns_dispatchmgr_setblackportlist(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr,
206 dns_portlist_t *portlist);
207/*%<
208 * This function is deprecated. Use dns_dispatchmgr_setavailports() instead.
209 *
210 * Requires:
211 *\li mgr is a valid dispatchmgr
212 */
213
214dns_portlist_t *
215dns_dispatchmgr_getblackportlist(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr);
216/*%<
217 * This function is deprecated and always returns NULL.
218 *
219 * Requires:
220 *\li mgr is a valid dispatchmgr
221 */
222
223isc_result_t
224dns_dispatchmgr_setavailports(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, isc_portset_t *v4portset,
225 isc_portset_t *v6portset);
226/*%<
227 * Sets a list of UDP ports that can be used for outgoing UDP messages.
228 *
229 * Requires:
230 *\li mgr is a valid dispatchmgr
231 *\li v4portset is NULL or a valid port set
232 *\li v6portset is NULL or a valid port set
233 */
234
235void
236dns_dispatchmgr_setstats(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, isc_stats_t *stats);
237/*%<
238 * Sets statistics counter for the dispatchmgr. This function is expected to
239 * be called only on zone creation (when necessary).
240 * Once installed, it cannot be removed or replaced. Also, there is no
241 * interface to get the installed stats from the zone; the caller must keep the
242 * stats to reference (e.g. dump) it later.
243 *
244 * Requires:
245 *\li mgr is a valid dispatchmgr with no managed dispatch.
246 *\li stats is a valid statistics supporting resolver statistics counters
247 * (see dns/stats.h).
248 */
249
250isc_result_t
251dns_dispatch_getudp(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, isc_socketmgr_t *sockmgr,
252 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr, const isc_sockaddr_t *localaddr,
253 unsigned int buffersize,
254 unsigned int maxbuffers, unsigned int maxrequests,
255 unsigned int buckets, unsigned int increment,
256 unsigned int attributes, unsigned int mask,
257 dns_dispatch_t **dispp);
258
259isc_result_t
260dns_dispatch_getudp_dup(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, isc_socketmgr_t *sockmgr,
261 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr, const isc_sockaddr_t *localaddr,
262 unsigned int buffersize,
263 unsigned int maxbuffers, unsigned int maxrequests,
264 unsigned int buckets, unsigned int increment,
265 unsigned int attributes, unsigned int mask,
266 dns_dispatch_t **dispp, dns_dispatch_t *dup);
267/*%<
268 * Attach to existing dns_dispatch_t if one is found with dns_dispatchmgr_find,
269 * otherwise create a new UDP dispatch.
270 *
271 * Requires:
272 *\li All pointer parameters be valid for their respective types.
273 *
274 *\li dispp != NULL && *disp == NULL
275 *
276 *\li 512 <= buffersize <= 64k
277 *
278 *\li maxbuffers > 0
279 *
280 *\li buckets < 2097169
281 *
282 *\li increment > buckets
283 *
284 *\li (attributes & DNS_DISPATCHATTR_TCP) == 0
285 *
286 * Returns:
287 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS -- success.
288 *
289 *\li Anything else -- failure.
290 */
291
292isc_result_t
293dns_dispatch_createtcp(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, isc_socket_t *sock,
294 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr, const isc_sockaddr_t *localaddr,
295 const isc_sockaddr_t *destaddr, unsigned int buffersize,
296 unsigned int maxbuffers, unsigned int maxrequests,
297 unsigned int buckets, unsigned int increment,
298 unsigned int attributes, dns_dispatch_t **dispp);
299/*%<
300 * Create a new dns_dispatch and attach it to the provided isc_socket_t.
301 *
302 * For all dispatches, "buffersize" is the maximum packet size we will
303 * accept.
304 *
305 * "maxbuffers" and "maxrequests" control the number of buffers in the
306 * overall system and the number of buffers which can be allocated to
307 * requests.
308 *
309 * "buckets" is the number of buckets to use, and should be prime.
310 *
311 * "increment" is used in a collision avoidance function, and needs to be
312 * a prime > buckets, and not 2.
313 *
314 * Requires:
315 *
316 *\li mgr is a valid dispatch manager.
317 *
318 *\li sock is a valid.
319 *
320 *\li task is a valid task that can be used internally to this dispatcher.
321 *
322 * \li 512 <= buffersize <= 64k
323 *
324 *\li maxbuffers > 0.
325 *
326 *\li maxrequests <= maxbuffers.
327 *
328 *\li buckets < 2097169 (the next prime after 65536 * 32)
329 *
330 *\li increment > buckets (and prime).
331 *
332 *\li attributes includes #DNS_DISPATCHATTR_TCP and does not include
333 * #DNS_DISPATCHATTR_UDP.
334 *
335 * Returns:
336 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS -- success.
337 *
338 *\li Anything else -- failure.
339 */
340
341void
342dns_dispatch_attach(dns_dispatch_t *disp, dns_dispatch_t **dispp);
343/*%<
344 * Attach to a dispatch handle.
345 *
346 * Requires:
347 *\li disp is valid.
348 *
349 *\li dispp != NULL && *dispp == NULL
350 */
351
352void
353dns_dispatch_detach(dns_dispatch_t **dispp);
354/*%<
355 * Detaches from the dispatch.
356 *
357 * Requires:
358 *\li dispp != NULL and *dispp be a valid dispatch.
359 */
360
361void
362dns_dispatch_starttcp(dns_dispatch_t *disp);
363/*%<
364 * Start processing of a TCP dispatch once the socket connects.
365 *
366 * Requires:
367 *\li 'disp' is valid.
368 */
369
370isc_result_t
371dns_dispatch_gettcp(dns_dispatchmgr_t *mgr, const isc_sockaddr_t *destaddr,
372 const isc_sockaddr_t *localaddr, bool *connected,
373 dns_dispatch_t **dispp);
374/*
375 * Attempt to connect to a existing TCP connection (connection completed
376 * if connected == NULL).
377 */
378
379
380isc_result_t
381dns_dispatch_addresponse(dns_dispatch_t *disp, unsigned int options,
382 const isc_sockaddr_t *dest, isc_task_t *task,
383 isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg,
384 uint16_t *idp, dns_dispentry_t **resp,
385 isc_socketmgr_t *sockmgr);
386/*%<
387 * Add a response entry for this dispatch.
388 *
389 * "*idp" is filled in with the assigned message ID, and *resp is filled in
390 * to contain the magic token used to request event flow stop.
391 *
392 * Arranges for the given task to get a callback for response packets. When
393 * the event is delivered, it must be returned using dns_dispatch_freeevent()
394 * or through dns_dispatch_removeresponse() for another to be delivered.
395 *
396 * Requires:
397 *\li "idp" be non-NULL.
398 *
399 *\li "task" "action" and "arg" be set as appropriate.
400 *
401 *\li "dest" be non-NULL and valid.
402 *
403 *\li "resp" be non-NULL and *resp be NULL
404 *
405 *\li "sockmgr" be NULL or a valid socket manager. If 'disp' has
406 * the DNS_DISPATCHATTR_EXCLUSIVE attribute, this must not be NULL,
407 * which also means dns_dispatch_addresponse() cannot be used.
408 *
409 * Ensures:
410 *
411 *\li &lt;id, dest> is a unique tuple. That means incoming messages
412 * are identifiable.
413 *
414 * Returns:
415 *
416 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS -- all is well.
417 *\li ISC_R_NOMEMORY -- memory could not be allocated.
418 *\li ISC_R_NOMORE -- no more message ids can be allocated
419 * for this destination.
420 */
421
422
423void
424dns_dispatch_removeresponse(dns_dispentry_t **resp,
425 dns_dispatchevent_t **sockevent);
426/*%<
427 * Stops the flow of responses for the provided id and destination.
428 * If "sockevent" is non-NULL, the dispatch event and associated buffer is
429 * also returned to the system.
430 *
431 * Requires:
432 *\li "resp" != NULL and "*resp" contain a value previously allocated
433 * by dns_dispatch_addresponse();
434 *
435 *\li May only be called from within the task given as the 'task'
436 * argument to dns_dispatch_addresponse() when allocating '*resp'.
437 */
438
439isc_socket_t *
440dns_dispatch_getentrysocket(dns_dispentry_t *resp);
441
442isc_socket_t *
443dns_dispatch_getsocket(dns_dispatch_t *disp);
444/*%<
445 * Return the socket associated with this dispatcher.
446 *
447 * Requires:
448 *\li disp is valid.
449 *
450 * Returns:
451 *\li The socket the dispatcher is using.
452 */
453
454isc_result_t
455dns_dispatch_getlocaladdress(dns_dispatch_t *disp, isc_sockaddr_t *addrp);
456/*%<
457 * Return the local address for this dispatch.
458 * This currently only works for dispatches using UDP sockets.
459 *
460 * Requires:
461 *\li disp is valid.
462 *\li addrp to be non null.
463 *
464 * Returns:
465 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
466 *\li ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED
467 */
468
469void
470dns_dispatch_cancel(dns_dispatch_t *disp);
471/*%<
472 * cancel outstanding clients
473 *
474 * Requires:
475 *\li disp is valid.
476 */
477
478unsigned int
479dns_dispatch_getattributes(dns_dispatch_t *disp);
480/*%<
481 * Return the attributes (DNS_DISPATCHATTR_xxx) of this dispatch. Only the
482 * non-changeable attributes are expected to be referenced by the caller.
483 *
484 * Requires:
485 *\li disp is valid.
486 */
487
488void
489dns_dispatch_changeattributes(dns_dispatch_t *disp,
490 unsigned int attributes, unsigned int mask);
491/*%<
492 * Set the bits described by "mask" to the corresponding values in
493 * "attributes".
494 *
495 * That is:
496 *
497 * \code
498 * new = (old & ~mask) | (attributes & mask)
499 * \endcode
500 *
501 * This function has a side effect when #DNS_DISPATCHATTR_NOLISTEN changes.
502 * When the flag becomes off, the dispatch will start receiving on the
503 * corresponding socket. When the flag becomes on, receive events on the
504 * corresponding socket will be canceled.
505 *
506 * Requires:
507 *\li disp is valid.
508 *
509 *\li attributes are reasonable for the dispatch. That is, setting the UDP
510 * attribute on a TCP socket isn't reasonable.
511 */
512
513void
514dns_dispatch_importrecv(dns_dispatch_t *disp, isc_event_t *event);
515/*%<
516 * Inform the dispatcher of a socket receive. This is used for sockets
517 * shared between dispatchers and clients. If the dispatcher fails to copy
518 * or send the event, nothing happens.
519 *
520 * If the attribute DNS_DISPATCHATTR_NOLISTEN is not set, then
521 * the dispatch is already handling a recv; return immediately.
522 *
523 * Requires:
524 *\li disp is valid, and the attribute DNS_DISPATCHATTR_NOLISTEN is set.
525 * event != NULL
526 */
527
528dns_dispatch_t *
529dns_dispatchset_get(dns_dispatchset_t *dset);
530/*%<
531 * Retrieve the next dispatch from dispatch set 'dset', and increment
532 * the round-robin counter.
533 *
534 * Requires:
535 *\li dset != NULL
536 */
537
538isc_result_t
539dns_dispatchset_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_socketmgr_t *sockmgr,
540 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr, dns_dispatch_t *source,
541 dns_dispatchset_t **dsetp, int n);
542/*%<
543 * Given a valid dispatch 'source', create a dispatch set containing
544 * 'n' UDP dispatches, with the remainder filled out by clones of the
545 * source.
546 *
547 * Requires:
548 *\li source is a valid UDP dispatcher
549 *\li dsetp != NULL, *dsetp == NULL
550 */
551
552void
553dns_dispatchset_cancelall(dns_dispatchset_t *dset, isc_task_t *task);
554/*%<
555 * Cancel socket operations for the dispatches in 'dset'.
556 */
557
558void
559dns_dispatchset_destroy(dns_dispatchset_t **dsetp);
560/*%<
561 * Dereference all the dispatches in '*dsetp', free the dispatchset
562 * memory, and set *dsetp to NULL.
563 *
564 * Requires:
565 *\li dset is valid
566 */
567
568void
569dns_dispatch_setdscp(dns_dispatch_t *disp, isc_dscp_t dscp);
570isc_dscp_t
571dns_dispatch_getdscp(dns_dispatch_t *disp);
572/*%<
573 * Set/get the DSCP value to be used when sending responses to clients,
574 * as defined in the "listen-on" or "listen-on-v6" statements.
575 *
576 * Requires:
577 *\li disp is valid.
578 */
579
580isc_result_t
581dns_dispatch_getnext(dns_dispentry_t *resp, dns_dispatchevent_t **sockevent);
582/*%<
583 * Free the sockevent and trigger the sending of the next item off the
584 * dispatch queue if present.
585 *
586 * Requires:
587 *\li resp is valid
588 *\li *sockevent to be valid
589 */
590
591ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
592
593#endif /* DNS_DISPATCH_H */
